entry.title: In One Minute : Laravel
entry.summary:
The Laravel framework is an open-sourced PHP web framework that allows developers to create dynamic and scalable web applications. The source code of Laravel is hosted on GitHub and released under the MIT license. Laravel helps you create applications with expressive, elegant syntax. The current Laravel version is 9.x. For all Laravel releases, bug fixes are provided for 18 months, and security fixes are provided for two years. Major framework releases are released yearly, while minor and patch releases may be released weekly.
Some of the features of Laravel are a modular packaging system with a dedicated dependency manager, different ways for accessing relational databases, utilities that aid in application deployment and maintenance, and its orientation toward syntactic sugar. Laravel.io Forum GitHub Repository Laracasts Forums LaraChat Laravel Old Archive Forum LaraJobs Scotch.io: Tutorials Code Happy: Laravel book by Dayle Rees Laravel Starter: Laravel book by Shawn McCool Creating a Blog in Laravel from Scratch Nettuts+ Tag about Laravel Fideloper Laravel Tag Jason Lewis' Tutorials Laravel 4 â€“ simple website with backend tutorial Laracasts - Laravel Screencasts by Jeffrey Way Sheikh Heera's Blog (Tag - Laravel) Laravel.sl - Fast French tutorial Awesome Laravel Installation steps Cachet Introduction to Laravel (Persian) Laravel News Test Driven Laravel (by Adam Wathan) Behaviour Driven Development in Laravel Laravel Best Practices Laravel Up and Running Diving Laravel Laravel Core Adventures Performant Laravel Laravel Subreddit Laravel up and running the first edition Laravel: Up & Running 2nd Edition The Laravel Podcast The Laravel Snippet by Taylor Otwell Laravel News Podcast by Laravel News

entry.title: Rust Easy! Modern Cross-platform Command Line Tools to Supercharge Your Terminal
entry.summary: Originally published at deepu.tech. Rust is taking over the terminal. Rust is a general-purpose programming language that is blazing fast and memory safe. It is the fastest-growing and most loved programming language in the world. It is used to build everything from operating systems to web servers to command-line tools. Recently there has been a surge of command line tools and utilities written in Rust, and many of them are intended to replace standard Unix commands. They are faster, more user-friendly, and have more features than their standard Unix counterparts. In this post, I will cover some of the best Rust command line tools I have used for a while. You can also use these to supercharge your terminal. These tools are available for both Linux and macOS. I have not tested them on Windâ€¦

entry.title: Devialet brings its sci-fi design aesthetics to a $790 portable speaker
entry.summary:
The speaker maintains the sci-fi aesthetic that Devialet is known for. | Image: Devialet
Devialet, the French audio company best known for its lineup of eye-catching audio gear that looks like Daft Punk helmets, is getting into the portable smart speaker business. Today, itâ€™s announcing the Devialet Mania, a battery-powered speaker that retains the companyâ€™s signature sci-fi stylings but in a compact form factor that it says offers 10 hours of battery life at â€œmoderate volumes.â€ The Mania includes four full-range drivers and two sub-woofers, which Devialet says offer 360-degree sound. But perhaps more interesting is how the speaker adjusts its sound profile based on measurements of your listening space it takes from its four microphones. Place the speaker up near a wall, for example, and Devialet claims the speakerâ€™s two... Continue readingâ€¦

entry.title: CD onboarding with Harness using Azure.
entry.summary:
What is Harness?âš“
Harness is the industry's first Software Delivery Platform to use AI to simplify your DevOps processes - CI, CD, Feature Flags, Cloud Costs, and much more. Why Harness?âš“
Harness is a modern software delivery platform that allows engineers and DevOps to build, test, deploy, and verify software, on-demand. What is Cloud Delivery Pipeline (CD Pipeline)?âš“
A CD Pipeline is a series of Stages where each Stage deploys a Service to an Environment.A CD Pipeline can perform many additional CD operations, including, but not limited to: Propagating Services and their definitions across Stages Approvals using integrations like Jira and ServiceNow. Synchronizing stage deployments using barriers. Notifications. Harness using Microsoft Azure!
PreFlight Checklist!âš“

entry.title: AWS open source newsletter, #134
entry.summary:
November 7th, 2022 - Instalment #134
Welcome Welcome to the AWS open source newsletter, edition #134. This weeks newsletter was featured in the latest Build on Open Source on twitch.tv/aws, so I hope some of you were able to tune in and watch. New projects that we featured include "enclaver", a toolkit to make working with enclaves easier, "s3crets_scanner" a new secrets scanning tool, "sandbox-accounts-for-events" a way to easily vend temporary environments, "frontend-discovery" helps you define and drive adoption of a frontend discovery patterns, "cf-sam-openapi-file-organization-demo", a tool to help you get started with API development, "decoupling-microservices-lambda-amazonmq-rabbitmq" a sample solution to get you started on how to use micro services with RabbitMQ, "how-to-write-moâ€¦

entry.title: Profitable Growth: 4 Ways Personalization Can Accelerate Profitability During a Downturn
entry.summary:
It's no secret that the days of free-flowing VC cash are over. With the recent economic downturn, investors are carefully scrutinizing companies' financials and growth potential. As a result, profitability has become more important than ever before. And European tech funding data supports this statement:
When we do a quick recap of the graph, we can easily see that: The investment amount in the third quarter of 2022 declined by 52% compared to the first quarter of the year When it comes to comparing with the previous year's Q3, the decline is 49% For the past decade, the tech industry has been driven by a "growth at all costs" mentality. This has led to a situation where many startups focus on raising capital and achieving rapid growth rather than generating profits. However, this approacâ€¦

entry.title: What you actually need to know about open source to get started
entry.summary:
What you actually need to know about open source to get started Katie Edwards Mon, 11/07/2022 - 03:00
So you want (or need) to figure out what "open source" really means. I'll cover the basics of open source, whether you're interested in contributing to a project or want to be in the loop at a new job where the term keeps getting thrown around. Full disclosure: I am a person with little technical experience, working in the content-design fringes of a very technical open source environment. Given my background in marketing and communication, I felt like a fish out of water when I made this career switch. Git, data science, the ins and outs of softwareâ€¦ It was, and still is a year later, a lot to comprehend. But that's why I'm writing this piece. I want to help make open sourceâ€¦

entry.title: Build your own SaaS on Linux with Vely
entry.summary:
Build your own SaaS on Linux with Vely Sergio Mijatovic Mon, 11/07/2022 - 03:00
Vely combines high performance and the low footprint of C with the ease of use and improved safety of languages like PHP. It's free and open source software, licensed under GPLv3 and LGPL 3 for libraries, so you can even build commercial software with it. Using Vely for SaaS You can use Vely to create a multitenant web application that you can run on the Internet as Software-as-a-Service (SaaS). Each user has a completely separate data space from any other. In this example web application, a user can sign up for a notebook service to create notes and then view and delete them. It demonstrates several technology integrations in just 310 lines of code across seven source files. The technologies inclâ€¦

entry.title: Building a Web Scraper in Golang: Complete Tutorial
entry.summary: Ever wondered how to build a web scraper in Golang? Check out this practical tutorial. Golang, or Go, is designed to leverage the static typing and run-time efficiency of C and usability of Python and JavaScript, with added features of high-performance networking and multiprocessing. Itâ€™s also compiled and excels in concurrency, making it quick. This article will guide you through the step-by-step process of writing a fast and efficient Golang web scraper that can extract public data from a target website. Installing Go To start, head over to the Go downloadsÂ page. Here you can download all of the common installers, such as Windows MSI installer, macOS Package, and Linux tarball. Go is open-source, meaning that if you wish to compile Go on your own, you can download the source code as welâ€¦

entry.title: Building an Awesome Carousel Reusable Component with React and Splide.js
entry.summary:
Introduction
Carousel, widely known as sliders, galleries, and slideshows, helps developers display text, graphics, images, and even video in one interactive, â€œslidingâ€ block. They're a great design option for grouping content and ideas together allowing you to form visual relationships between specific pieces of content. Components in ReactJS are basically reusable and independent bits of code that render the HTML and data passed to it. React has two component sides, the Function component, and the Class component. Splide.js is lightweight, flexible, and accessible, it is a library that aids in building sliders however you want to design your slides without writing any CSS styles or codes. In this tutorial, you will be learning how to build splide.js reusable carousel components for reâ€¦

entry.title: Chrome 107: Keyboard shortcuts
entry.summary:
I always look at the Chrome updates to see what cool new features the team added. Let's take a look at them. We first stumbled upon the new customized shortcuts in the DevTools option. You can now open your DevTools and navigate to settings. There you'll find "Shortcuts".
You'll also be able to adjust each shortcut to map to a different key if you prefer that.
It's super convenient to adjust shortcuts to whatever works best for us. Besides the option to modify any existing shortcuts, we get a new shortcut for toggling the preferred color scheme media query.
By default, the shortcut is empty. You can type and critical binding if you want to be active here. Once you set something, you can use this shortcut to switch between the themes quickly. What are some shortcuts you hope to see being added in the future? I'm personally thrilled with the preferred color scheme and hope to see more rendering shortcuts being added as we go. Thank you for reading my blog. Feel free to subscribe to my email newsletter and connect on Facebook or Twitter

entry.title: Rocket Crew 2.0 â€” The biggest list of Space industry jobs
entry.summary:
https://rocketcrew.space/talents
ğŸ’° Aerospace Salaries: A new section of the site allows aerospace professionals to share their salaries anonymously. The goal is to encourage transparency in this industry and help people negotiate their salaries. Already 500+ salary reports have been submitted and the average salary is $109k per year. You can also find more details about each report like the number of hours worked, years of experience, location, etc. Every salary is approved manually to be as accurate as possible. https://rocketcrew.space/salaries
ğŸ‰ Small wins. The site now ranks 1st in the US for the "space jobs" keyword! And in October, I was able to make $1000 from Space companies looking to hire someone!
ğŸ’ª I'm working to make Rocket Crew the go-to resource for someone wanting to work in this exciting industry, wish me luck haha!
Let me know if you have any questions!
ğŸš€ Btw, I'm looking forward to the SLS launch and Starship orbital test flight! â€

entry.title: Elon Muskâ€™s response to fake verified Elon Twitter accounts: a new permanent ban policy for impersonation
entry.summary:
Illustration by Kristen Radtke / The Verge; Getty Images
Elon Muskâ€™s Twitter has a new rule for everyone with an account on Twitter to follow, as he announced from his own account: â€œany Twitter handles engaging in impersonation without clearly specifying â€˜parodyâ€™ will be permanently suspended.â€ In a follow-up tweet, Musk said â€œPreviously, we issued a warning before suspension, but now that we are rolling out widespread verification, there will be no warning.â€ Going forward, any Twitter handles engaging in impersonation without clearly specifying â€œparodyâ€ will be permanently suspended â€” Elon Musk (@elonmusk) November 6, 2022
Any name change at all will cause temporary loss of verified checkmark â€” Elon Musk (@elonmusk) November 6, 2022
Itâ€™s an abrupt update from the person who just a... Continue readingâ€¦

entry.title: The iPhone 14 Pro and Pro Max will come with â€˜longer wait timesâ€™ due to factory lockdown
entry.summary:
Photo by Amelia Holowaty Krales / The Verge
Apple says to expect â€œlonger wait timesâ€ if you plan on ordering an iPhone 14 Pro or 14 Pro Max. In a press release, the company explains that covid restrictions are affecting its iPhone factory in Zhengzhou, China, which is currently â€œoperating at significantly reduced capacity.â€ â€œWe continue to see strong demand for iPhone 14 Pro and iPhone 14 Pro Max models,â€ Apple says. â€œHowever, we now expect lower iPhone 14 Pro and iPhone 14 Pro Max shipments than we previously anticipated and customers will experience longer wait times to receive their new products.â€ In October, a report from Reuters revealed that iPhone production could slump by at least 30 percent due to the strict covid restrictions affecting Foxconn, the China-based factory... entry.title: Metaâ€™s reportedly planning to lay off â€˜thousandsâ€™ of workers this week
entry.summary:
Illustration by Nick Barclay / The Verge
Metaâ€™s planning major job cuts that could affect â€œthousandsâ€ of workers, according to a report from The Wall Street Journal. Sources familiar with the situation told the WSJ that the layoffs could begin as soon as Wednesday. The Facebook and Instagram parent company reported over 87,000 employees at the end of September, but these â€œlarge-scaleâ€ layoffs are expected to slash a significant portion of staff members. According to the WSJ, the layoffs could hit Meta even harder than the mass job cuts at Twitter, which affected about half of the companyâ€™s 7,500-employee workforce. In June, Metaâ€™s chief product officer Chris Cox warned employees of â€œserious times,â€ noting that employees must â€œexecute flawlessly in an environment of slower... Continue readingâ€¦

entry.title: Twitterâ€™s delaying the launch of Blue with verification until after the elections
entry.summary:
Illustration by Alex Castro / The Verge
Twitterâ€™s pushing back the launch of its new Blue subscription with verification until after this weekâ€™s midterm elections, according to a report from The New York Times. According to an internal memo viewed by the outlet, a manager working on the project said theyâ€™ve â€œmade the decision to move the launch of this release to Nov. 9, after the election.â€ Elon Musk, Twitterâ€™s new owner, announced the new $7.99 per month Twitter Blue earlier this month with perks like fewer ads, search priority, the ability to post longer videos, and the ability to pay your way to verification. Under Muskâ€™s new rules, anyone can get a verified checkmark if they pay for Blue, sparking concern over whether users will be able to tell real accounts from fake... Continue readingâ€¦

entry.title: Appleâ€™s copyright claims ripped down a fanâ€™s archival WWDC YouTube channel
entry.summary:
Illustration by Alex Castro / The Verge
After Apple issued several copyright claims, YouTube took down an archival channel containing hundreds of decades-old videos from past Apple Worldwide Developer Conferences (WWDC). Brendan Shanks, the owner of the Apple WWDC Videos channel, says his accountâ€™s been permanently disabled after receiving well over three copyright strikes â€” the maximum number of violations you can incur before YouTube removes your account. In screenshots of emails shared by Shanks, Apple issued a number of takedown requests against his videos, some of which dated back to the early 2000s. Shanks says he still has all the original video files and descriptions, and is currently trying to get the content over to the Internet Archive. Apple didnâ€™t immediately... Continue readingâ€¦

entry.title: Apple reportedly wants to swap the â€˜Hey Siriâ€™ trigger phrase for just â€˜Siriâ€™
entry.summary:
Illustration by Alex Castro / The Verge
Appleâ€™s looking to change Siriâ€™s trigger phrase from â€œHey Siri,â€ to just â€œSiri,â€ according to a report from Bloombergâ€™s Mark Gurman. This means you would just need to say â€œSiriâ€ followed by a command to activate the smart assistant. As noted by Gurman, Appleâ€™s been working on this feature for the past several months and is expected to roll it out next year or in 2024. But Apple will have to put in a â€œsignificant amount of AI training and underlying engineering work,â€ to get the feature to function properly, as the smart assistant will need to understand the single wake word in multiple accents and dialects. The current, two-word trigger phrase, â€œHey Siri,â€ increases the chance of Siri picking up on it. Switching to a single wake word... Continue readingâ€¦

entry.title: Crisp Widget â€” The all-in-one website widget - reinvented
entry.summary:
Crisp widget ğŸ’¬ğŸ’™
Since 2015, we've always worked hard to bring the best website chat experience for our customers around the world.
Today marks a new era at Crisp as our widget has been totally rebuilt to offer a brand-new website experience.
This new widget doesn't only pave the way for a better conversational experience, but also establishes Crisp as an all-in-one multichannel support tool for brands around the world.
Our next-generation website widget is powered by VueJS, allowing for unprecedented website performance and lightweightness.
No more small talk, here is what's new and how you can benefit from it:
- Make communication asynchronous by pushing help articles before getting conversational ğŸ“š - Craft social commerce experiences right from your website or on any channel (WhatsApp, Instagram, or Messenger are supported) ğŸ’° - Get customer satisfaction score from the chat or on any channel â­ï¸
And it is just getting started but so we're really excited to hear your feedback.
Looking forward to hearing your thoughts. â€
Discussion | Link

entry.title: Fix scanned images with ImageMagick
entry.summary:
Fix scanned images with ImageMagick Seth Kenlon Sat, 11/05/2022 - 03:00
Years ago while rummaging through the contents of a shelf in a used bookstore, I happened upon a booklet titled "UNIX System Command Summary for Berkeley 4.2 & 4.3 BSD," published byÂ Specialized Systems Consultants. I bought it as a curiosity item because it was nearly 20 years old yet still largely applicable to modern Linux and BSD. That amused me then and now. A booklet written in 1986 was still largely relevant in 2016, while books on the same shelf about a proprietary OS weren't worth the paper they were printed on. (Think about it: What technology doÂ youÂ think is going to survive a zombie apocalypse?) I've had the booklet on my own bookshelf for several years now, but it occurred to me that it's proâ€¦

entry.title: Is Lua worth learning?
entry.summary:
Is Lua worth learning? Seth Kenlon Thu, 11/03/2022 - 03:00
Lua is a scripting language used for procedural programming, functional programming, and even object-oriented programming. It uses a C-like syntax, but is dynamically typed, features automatic memory management and garbage collection, and runs by interpreting bytecode with a register-based virtual machine. This makes it a great language for beginners, but also a powerful tool for experienced programmers. Lua has been somewhat eclipsed from the public view by languages like Python and JavaScript, but Lua has several advantages that make it popular in some major software projects. Lua is easily embedded within other languages, meaning that you can include Lua files in the code base of something written in (for instance)â€¦

entry.title: How open source weaves connections between countries
entry.summary:
How open source weaves connections between countries Phil Shapiro Thu, 11/03/2022 - 03:00
Long ago, when I was a tech administrator for Arlington Public Schools, I received an unexpected email saying, "Our school in India loves your children's stories, so we've printed them all out in braille." Apparently, the school had found my collection of children's stories on the web. I spent a moment visualizing those students so far away, enjoying my stories on those printed pages of braille. The email's sender might not have realized how meaningful their email was to me, but it's stayed with me for two decades. Tell collaborative stories with open source That experience got me thinking about how technology can weave new connections between people in different countries. While surfingâ€¦

entry.title: CodÃ©dex â€” Learn to code for Gen Z
entry.summary:
CodÃ©dex â€“ a brand new learn to code platform for Gen Z.
The team is based in Brooklyn, NY and we started working on this full-time in June. Our mission is to empower the next generation of builders and dreamers.
Collectively, we have taught Computer Science at Columbia, NYU, CUNY, and brought programming to over 50 million users around the world at Codecademy and Lambda School.
Each challenge is curated by world-class educators and engineers, and works both in classrooms and online settings.
Check out our website: www.codedex.io âœ¨
Here are a few things that we offer:
ğŸ“ Courses: â€œThe Legend of Pythonâ€ course is where you should start if you are starting your coding journey. ğŸš€ Projects: Our catalog of project tutorials for intermediate coders to build real-world applets. ğŸŒ Community: We have a beginner-friendly Discord community with code mentors who will help you 24/7.
And if you still have questions, just comment here, and weâ€™ll get right back to you.
Lastly, huge shoutout out to the whole team: Dharma, Malcolm, Asiqur, Jerry, Rose, and Lillian for working on this night and day for last few months. LFG!
Happy coding, Sonny ğŸ¤ â€

entry.title: Achieve smart home interoperability with open source technology
entry.summary:
Achieve smart home interoperability with open source technology Florian Robert Wed, 11/02/2022 - 03:00
Advertisers sell the myth of the "Smart Home" as a magical world where you automate everything with ease to simplify your life and free your mind of trivial tasks. It looks great on paper and TV, but so far, it's mainly been a battle of technologies and manufacturers. Suppose you want to add a presence sensor from manufacturer A to your existing hub from manufacturer B so you can switch ON your light from manufacturer B. Or perhaps you want to switch OFF your air conditioner when your door is open, but the door sensor is not from the air conditioning manufacturer. Will it work? There's a significant chance that the devices you want to link to one another don't talk the same â€¦

entry.title: Get started with Parseable, an open source log storage and observability platform
entry.summary:
Get started with Parseable, an open source log storage and observability platform Nitish Tiwari Tue, 11/01/2022 - 03:00
Log data is one of the fastest-growing segments across data storage. It's also one of the most complicated spaces. There are several products and solutions with overlapping use cases and confusing marketing. This article looks at Parseable, a log storage and observability platform. Parseable is geared towards a better user experience, with an easy-to-deploy and use interface and a simple, cloud-native architecture. I'll also show how to set up Parseable with FluentBit to store logs.
More on Microservices Microservices cheat sheet How to explain microservices to your CEO Free eBook: Microservices vs. service-oriented architecture Free online course: Developiâ€¦

entry.title: Transfer files and folders from Windows to Linux with WinSCP
entry.summary:
Transfer files and folders from Windows to Linux with WinSCP Paul Tue, 11/01/2022 - 03:00
Sometimes you need to transfer files over a network. There are lots of file sharing services out there, but most require that you send your file to the Internet. This seems like a long way to go (not to mention the privacy concerns) when two computers are right beside each other, or at least in the same building. The open source WinSCP utility makes it quick and easy to transfer a file or a folder of files over the network from your Windows computer to your Linux computer.

entry.title: 20 technology horror stories about learning the hard way
entry.summary:
20 technology horror stories about learning the hard way AmyJune Hineline Mon, 10/31/2022 - 03:00
Halloween will be here before you know it! This fun, over-the-top holiday is a great time to ponder the mortal fears of the developer in each of us. What haunts you the most, in the quiet moments just before your code starts to run? Getting into the spirit of Halloween, I asked some Opensource.com writers: What's the scariest code you've seen or written?
